intro: Hydrostachys madagascariensis, commonly known as the Madagascar watergrass, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It is a member of the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its tufted growth habit and narrow, grass-like leaves. It typically grows in wet or marshy environments, thriving in humid conditions. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are clustered in spikelets, typical of the sedge family.
